docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: It is hardly to be expected that newspapers will probe into their own culpability for the climate which produced Watergate. We shall continue to be treated with tedious self-praise of a valiant, free press.

headline.main: Letters to the Editor; Of 'Wanton' Newsmen and a 'Pious' Conspirator Subs for Oil Transport

docs.abstract: J Cordy lr notes irony of fact that astronauts can spin safely in outer space laboratory while 2 slow-moving trains on fixed track on earth cannot be prevented from hitting each other
docs.snippet: To the Editor: It is hardly to be expected that newspapers will probe into their own culpability for the climate which produced Watergate. We shall continue to be treated with tedious self-praise of a valiant, free press.

byline.original: (Bishop) THOMAS F. REILLYKENNETH BADERA. K. STADEE. ANTHONY PETRELLI, M.D.JOHN CORDYRoss JACOBSDAVID B. GURALNIK
